website_summaries.verdict: The Onkyo TX-NR609 is an exciting, well-connected, 3D-compatible AV receiver that bristles with features, including Internet radio and support for Spotify Premium. It's something of a belter.
pros: Support for Spotify Premium and other music streaming services
cons: can sound ragged when all channels are driven at volume
network audio streaming needs some polish

customer_reviews.title: Faulty HDMI Board - "recalled but not really"
customer_reviews.text: Was an okay receiver for a while, nothing special, hard to configure and get everything "just right" I know it's discontinued now, but wanted to post this regardless... I was just hit by the HDMI/Network board issue - just google for "TX-NR609 No Audio No Network" Talking to the people at onkyo and via their website recall page, my specific receiver is not one of the affected; however, my lack of audio and all the other symptoms which are EXACTLY THE SAME beg to differ... Now this is another piece of garbage to throw out... Onkyo wants more than i paid for the receiver to fix it... will not be buying another onkyo again, their customer support is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: No Sound After Two Years
customer_reviews.text: Well, after 25 months, my sound went out just like the others. I have ordered the following capacitors to replace them myself for the HDMI board. This isn't acceptable and I won't be purchasing another Onkyo product anytime soon.  04/14/2014 - Onkyo has agreed to a "one-time" repair even though the unit is out of warranty. I haven't even received the capacitors yet, but will probably take them up on their offer. They could have taken the easy way out, but they seem to be standing behind their product. 01/16/17 - Unit was repaired and is still working well.
customer_reviews.author: Slider162

customer_reviews.title: Onkyo needs to fix one or the other
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 3 different models of Onkyo in the past, from which two stopped working after a few years. The last has the common "known problems" with HDMI, but unfortunately my S/N does not fall in the covered warranty, and I simply don't have time to fight with the customer service. I will have to switch to another brand most likely Marantz or Pioneer.
customer_reviews.author: RonR

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for 2 years, then dead like many others I read about
customer_reviews.text: Purchased December 2011. Its now March 31, 2014 and its dead. The HDMI out is having issues, but from reading the forums, its pretty common for the NR606 and 609 to fail right after 2 years. It started with the HDMI going out for a few minutes. I'd turn it off and on and most of the time it would come back - terrible for watching a movie. This week though it just failed altogether. Sound was fine but no picture. Nothing could get it to work. It's just dead. There are some videos on replacing the HDMI capacitors and perhaps I will try that but what a pain for an expensive receiver that is 2 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Justin J.

customer_reviews.title: Lineage HDMI board problem
customer_reviews.text: Always owned Onkyo AVRs. Purchased and installed this model in a 7.2 setup with two channels of zone 2 on the deck. The AVR sounded great, was packed with features and every known connection available. Past tense because it............. like many of its brothers and sisters died from heart failure. HDMI boards clunk out due to heat and you get 0 sound or 0 video. Mine suffered from the 0 sound. The HDMI board problem is a known problem with several lineage models through a couple of years. Very, very nice 800.00 paper weight. Getting ready to buy me another one and hope that Onkyo has solved this problem............... fool me twice, hello Denon.
customer_reviews.author: JB109

customer_reviews.title: Short Service Life
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the low ratings that some people have given Onkyo receivers. Mine lasted for 3 years and now it will display the various inputs but not the sound. It seems that something in the sound part is burned out. This receiver has a lot of fine features and while I worked it had amazing sound BUT a receiver of this quality and PRICE should not quit working in three years. FYI i did make sure it was not on mute. I cycled the power several time and finally hooked the Tivo directly to the TV and got sound from the TV with no problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Van Ord

customer_reviews.title: Almost 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about a year and one of the channels must have overheated and fried. So I had to send it into a certified Onkyo repair facility to get it fixed up. This was free of charge since Onkyo honored the basic warranty. It's still going strong do this day, it's been about 3 years with no issues. Plenty of options built into the reciever, plenty of power for basic needs. I'm running two large Polk towers, 2 BIC subwoofers, once Polk center, and two mid sized Polk surround speakers at once with this guy. Works with my 3D TV just fine. For the money this is a solid receiver, just make sure you give it enough breathing room.
customer_reviews.author: John D

customer_reviews.title: Got me twice Onkyo...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Onkyo 707 that died right after the warranty ran out...they did agree to fix it and I was lucky enough to have a local repair center...3 trips to the repair center, gone for weeks at a time and never worked correctly again, they finally just offered me a "deal" on an open box item from their website. I always considered Onkyo a premium brand so I assumed they had their issues figured out with 707s and corrected with the x09 series...nope, 2.5 years later and my 609 is dead with same issue. Open vented cabinet so I dont think its my fault...NEVER again Onkyo!
customer_reviews.author: Wolfeman

customer_reviews.title: It just didn't last.  The first thing to go were the HDMI ports
customer_reviews.text: For the money this seemed to be the right choice, but in the end it just didn't last and ended up in the junk pile. The HDMI ports were faulty. I replaced with a Yamaha which I am much happier with.
customer_reviews.author: John Clarke Michaels

customer_reviews.title: It WAS a great receiver.
customer_reviews.text: After these receivers get to be about 2 years old they suffer an alarming failure rate. I unfortunately learned this first hand. First the device stopped playing HDMI audio consistently. I attempted to do a firmware update following Onkyo's instructions very carefully. Their update failed mid process and now the receiver won't even fully turn on. Doing a just the most cursory research online shows a lot of people are experience the same problem. I will not be purchasing another Onkyo product after this as they take no responsibility for their faulty hardware and do not respond in a timely manner.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hayes

customer_reviews.title: worked for a while, then: static
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a while, then static, crackle, and fuzz appeared in the audio, especially noticeable at lower volumes. The manufacturer didn't have this model on their list of receivers that have static problems and are eligible for free repair, but it has static problems anyway. Their solution was to reset the unit to its factory settings, which did not help. Their second solution was that I ship the unit to a repair center; rather than live without TV and music for six to eight weeks, I'm probably just going to eat it and buy a receiver from a better manufacturer. My advice: buy a better-reviewed brand, like Yamaha. You don't want the static, trust me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HDMI ports stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Onkyo TX-NR609in Dec 2011. All worked okay until a few months later when the iPhone app wouldn't connect to the unit, but I really didn't use it much so it was a small issue. About 2 months ago the CBL HDMI port no longer worked with my Tivo so I changed Tivo to be the Game port and that worked. Last week all the ports no longer work. Just tried to return to Amazon and I was informed I could receive a "partial refund" but no details on what the "partial payment" would be. This really is annoying as I have been an Onkyo fan.
customer_reviews.author: NeilM

customer_reviews.title: Wow - blows my socks off!
customer_reviews.text: I will not try to mimic any audiophiles that have already posted accurate reviews on this receiver (thank you - that is why I purchased it). THIS RECEIVER IS AWESOME. My family and I watched 3 or 4 movies this weekend. Mostly action and one musical. I can say, I heard things while watching these movies that I have never heard before when watching (this receiver replaces a Sony). I heard background dialog and sound (song or background noise) that I never knew was there, or that I was missing. The setup was easy, the sound setup was easy (and impressive I must say), and the sound blows my mind. Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bee Happy

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 2 years then 1 month out of warrenty no sound
customer_reviews.text: I had this receiver since August 2011, it worked great no issues, had a ton of features and good sound quality. Then it went out of warrenty and suddenly no sound, currently it's off to be repaired, so my 3 start rating depends on A if it can be fixed and B how long it will take. I was at a 5 star rating for it until it had the hdmi board issues, I know receivers don't last forever but was hoping to get more than 2 years out of something this expensive. Appear onkyo really does have some quality control issues.
customer_reviews.author: Slippery

customer_reviews.title: Had this more than a year, no issues and excellent operation
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best receiver I have ever owned and is so easy to use. I have it hooked up to my LED projector with about 5 different devices plugged into it. I haven't even had to assign the inputs and outputs although I should reassign them - still have the Wii and the Blu Ray player hooked up to BD/DVD (wii on component vid and Blu-Ray to HDMI) but it doesn't care and always finds whatever device is turned on (wii or Blu Ray) then just plays it through. Robust, no issues after one year. Would definitely buy again and recommend to all my friends.
customer_reviews.author: HotRods4Ever

customer_reviews.title: My music and movies seem to always sound like crap even though I have a great set of ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this receiver about 3 years now. It's really hard to understand how to operate the different sound modes. My music and movies seem to always sound like crap even though I have a great set of speakers and an HDMI connection. I wish the equalizer were easier to access without having to go into so many sub-modes. I'm also getting a lot of noise in the high-channel in my floor speakers in bi-amp mode. It seems to be coming from the receiver itself even with no input, which doesn't make sense. My own personal opinion is that I wish I had spent my money on a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: G. Brinton

customer_reviews.title: Great Price and Sound is Great
customer_reviews.text: Using for 7.1 Theater - have had installed for over 6 years and works great - running 1080 and projector on 120" screen - it is the house for super bowl and all the big movie and sporting events. Would Buy Again..
customer_reviews.author: 1BarginHunter

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working just outside of 2 year warranty
customer_reviews.text: ...and it never worked that great to begin with. There was a up to a 100ms lag that needed to be adjusted for HDMI inputs (which is fine for video, but not videogames). I then bought a Denon at about the same price and the sound quality and user interface are both much better then the Onkyo. I would not buy Onkyo again. From what I read, the repair is around 300 dollars, so I guess this goes in the expensive garbage pile.
customer_reviews.author: Erik R. Johnsen

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for... There are better options out there, but they cost much more. Similarly, there are cheaper options out there, but they don't have near the features. Do your research and decide what features you think are worth paying for. Without going into details... great selection of audio modes (main reason I decided to step up form 500 series), hdmi switching, up-convert, and overall simplicity are amazing. I've used several different Onkyo products of the years and have been impressed with all of them.
customer_reviews.author: L. McDurmon

customer_reviews.title: Another failed unit...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this receiver in late 2011, and now, roughly 2.5 years later, it has failed - no sound. A quick search shows this is a common and KNOWN issue with this model by the manufacturer. We were very happy with the unit... until it failed! Awaiting resolution from Onkyo customer service. Will post an update if/when the issue is resolved.
customer_reviews.author: 7SEVENJ9

customer_reviews.title: Onkyo used to be a great product....
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, as much as I love Onkyo and have been an Onkyo customer for many many years, this product died and we were able to get it repaired at a local electronics shop under the warranty, although it had just past the warranty timeframe, it had a known issue with the main control board and it was replaced. 2 weeks later, it stopped working again. Sad to say I won't be purchasing another Onkyo unit for my surround sound needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: broke just after two years no video using hdmi passthrough
customer_reviews.text: Well the received worked well for the first two years. Then suddenly the picture went out on the tv. It appears the problem is the hdmi passthrough circuitry goes bad. Unfortunately now that I have researched this problem I have found this is a common problem with Onkyo Receivers. If you like throwing away money then I highly recommend this receiver. Buyer beware, google the problems others have had with the hdmi output and audio cutting out after a couple of years, then decide....
customer_reviews.author: G B

customer_reviews.title: Onkyo Quality Where Have You Gone?
customer_reviews.text: Why isn't this included in the recall? Obviously the HDMI components on all of these are bad. Purchased in November 2011 and have had multiple HDMI issue's requiring factory resets to resolve. This time even the factory reset will not solve the problem. I can get sound but no picture. Shame on you Onkyo. There is a HUGE quality issue with this model and you are choosing to ignore loyal customers. Off to shop for a Denon or Yamaha.
customer_reviews.author: HB808

customer_reviews.title: good value. good performance
customer_reviews.text: this has turned out to work reasonably well. this product gave me all of the functionality that i wanted at a very good price. the user-interface for the set-up process isn't all that one might wish for but it calibrated the speakers very well and over-all turned out better than i expected. i still have trouble getting the i-pod to play consistently, though. i seems to just "drop" the ipod after a few songs and there is no way to get it to keep playing. i don't connect the i-pod directly anymore.
customer_reviews.author: bluecitabria

customer_reviews.title: No sound problem with ridiculous hair dryer fix
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: Onkyo replaced my Onkyo after more than 4 years as they recognized a production defect. I was about to discard it and found the replacement program. Very nice on their part, but stay away from this model. No sound problem!!! Like lots and lots of other customers, mine failed after a couple of years with the bad solder in one of the hdmi board components. It only works if I leave a hair dryer on hanging on top of the component!! Ridiculous!!
customer_reviews.author: L. Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Great Receiver and Features
customer_reviews.text: I won't add much here except to say I am quite happy to own this receiver. Everyone elses comments are worth reading and informative. I wanted others to know that is your receiver experiences any speaker hiss and/or unexpected shutdowns to check the Onkyo website and see if its subject to a recall. Mine was affected and Onkyo will be repairing/replacing it. Update: Recall repair took 3 weeks (sent to returned) and the unit performs as expected now and I'm even more impressed with the units sound.
customer_reviews.author: MJ_Wencl

customer_reviews.title: It's not really a 7.2ch and I got it cheaper a year ago
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, I bought this receiver LAST xmas for $75 less than it is today. And it's not really a 7.2ch receiver as advertised. It has two jacks, but there's a big difference between having to sub-outs & having 7.2 surround. Anyways, had this reciever for almost a year not & to be honest, haven't had a problem out of it EXCEPT the stupid remote doesn't. Every so often I have to take the battery cover off & readjust the batteries so it will work after.....well you know, knocking it off my arm rest or something.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod Earnheart

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Had for over one year. No complaints. Does everything I need and probably more. Had another one in 7.1 and it is still going strong. Would buy again. Lowest THD out there as far as I know. I'm not a "phile" so I can't really speak to details or sound "excellence." I like what I hear. Yet to use it for music but the surround sound is great. Temporary setup so far but will be setting up permanently when I move and then will calibrate as indicated in manual.
customer_reviews.author: Lnd Svyr

customer_reviews.title: Awsome receiver
customer_reviews.text: This receiver sounds great. The calibration tool works, and I've also been able to broadcast to its web radio functionality using my PC and some web radio software. Sometimes the configuration tool seems a little bit clunky, and some HDMI signals that you wash through it come out differently. The price was right, this thing is an AWESOME value for the money. I've heard things in sound tracks and movies that I never knew were there before. Incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Ira Carmel

customer_reviews.title: The first receiver I have ever owned that just up ...
customer_reviews.text: The first receiver I have ever owned that just up and stopped working after two years. Not to mention, when I went online to possible find answers as to why, I discovered that Onkyo must be one of the most unreliable manufactures available since receiver after receiver seems to have the same issue of the sound just up and stops working and yet they keep putting them out there
customer_reviews.author: Evey Sauntering

customer_reviews.title: HDMI switcher failed twice in one year
customer_reviews.text: Purchased December 2011 for an aunt that wanted home theater. First experience with Onkyo, and most likely last. HDMI failed in June 2012. (no video output) $40 to ship to a *third party* (not the factory), where they replaced the HDMI board. Three week turn-around. And the board failed again in Dec 2012. Feature-wise, it is an excellent AVR at a competitive price. But the reliability of the HDMI is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Saturn

customer_reviews.title: great product...just right for the proper room
customer_reviews.text: this is a great receiver with all bells and whistles...does not have airplay but still has great options..and is a well conceived product..if u have apple tv then airplay is not big deal but would be nice if it were built in...all other streaming features work well and are intuitive...the set up is easy and the functionality of integration is awesome...toggling and switching work well....really love the unit..but make sure u do update or usb wifi toggle will not work...highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: melcuemba

customer_reviews.title: It works as long as you have Warranty
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 2011 & Worked fine until 2014 August after which there was no audio. After contacting Onkyo & they fixed something and everything was back working fine until 2015 August. This time there is no Video and Onkyo doesn't want to fix it. The maximum life of this receiver is three years, after which point you will start seeing issues with Audio & Video. I tried resetting the receiver numerous times and nothing worked. Moving back to a cheaper Sony receiver. I am never going to buy Onkyo products again.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only a year...
customer_reviews.text: My receiver that I purchased in November of 2011 just died. It lasted a year. Now I have to deal with shipping it to an authorized service center which is 160 miles away. It was nice when it worked, but I expected a longer life. Search for "TX-NR609 no video signal" and you'll find a bunch of topics of people with the same issue. You can hear audio, but can't see any video.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: I was fortunate to have mine last 4 years before it failed
customer_reviews.text: HDMI fails on this model. I was fortunate to have mine last 4 years before it failed. Onkyo repaired it for free even though it was out of warranty by the time it failed due to the extent of the known problem with this model. It has now failed again 1 year after the factory repair. I will personally never buy Onkyo again. Anyone reading this and thinking of picking up a used copy of this model should definitely not buy it; unless the price $1 with free shipping, you will come to regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Eister

customer_reviews.title: It broke, due to a well know issue with ...
customer_reviews.text: It broke, due to a well know issue with the network card. I tried to have it service by Onkyo but they said it would not be covered by the warranty and I would have to pay. It is my understanding that now Onkyo has extended the warranty on this item and others with the same problem to 2018. I threw mine away since it did not work.
customer_reviews.author: AndyB

customer_reviews.title: Great Receiver and a GREAT price
customer_reviews.text: I had an older Onkyo receiver from the late 90's and it was time to upgrade. I saw this one thru B*** B**'s website and liked it because it was Rhapsody ready, among its other features. I found this one on Amazon for over $200 less. With free shipping and no sales tax, I couldn't pass it up. I got a wi-fi adaptor off Amazon (not the Onkyo) and getting online was very easy. Overall, easy set up, great sound. Works great with new TV, too!
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware! This is a recalled product!
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE!!! It quit working after 6 months! Found out that thus was a recalled product because of it failing because of bad HDMI boards used in Onkyo's manufacturing this specific product.
customer_reviews.author: Honest  reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great in the beginning, then just stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: This Onkyo TX - NR609 worked great for 3 years, then just stopped transmitting sound through any audio channels - not DVD, not ipod, not TV, nothing. Very disappointed that after 3 years it just stopped. I have had my SONY receiver for over 15 years and it still works great. Follow up: After repair of HDMI board sound was working but now picture does not work - TV says no signal. After going on Onkyo chat rooms it seems I am not alone and most people say to use it as a paperweight. I agree. Try another brand if you are looking. I will never buy Onkyo again.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Roberts, PhD.

customer_reviews.title: Good unit without spending too much
customer_reviews.text: Very capable reciever with interesting features. Most notable is the use of a system calibration microphone (supplied) to set the speaker balance and tone for all speakers for your room. It was all automatic and hands free once invoked. By my ears, it works very well. I also like the smart switching of sources when going from blue ray, CD, TV, etc. Its not perfect, but when it detects the AV source, it resets the source to that unit. You can spend more and get a few more features, but this one fit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: waterguy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent audio and video upscalling!
customer_reviews.text: Onkyo TX-NR609 is considered as one of the best AC Receiver. The audio for 7.1ch. is superb, define and distinct for low, mid and trebble. But This is not good for Karaoke as this was intended for Home theater.
customer_reviews.author: Great Warrior

customer_reviews.title: Happy with them after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: It was OK while it worked. HDMI board failed after 2 years (one month out of warranty). Parts to fix are not available. When it worked, it was flaky requiring unplugging it for a minute to reset the relays. This was my 3rd Onkyo, replacing my second after failure ALSO just out of warranty. Just switched to Yamaha. Happy with them after 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: James DeMarchi

customer_reviews.title: Absolute piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from Amazon on 12/7/2011. Two weeks out of warranty the unit will not put out any sound. I have Googled 'No sound Onkyo TX-NR609 and found forums with hundreds of pages with people expressing the exact same issue. The problem is hardware related and seems to happen around 24 -30 months of use. In some cases Onkyo has done some good will repairs but the owner still needs to send it in at their expense. For me, I would need to send to Michigan from Utah. Stay clear of this one....
customer_reviews.author: A. Juston

customer_reviews.title: Good Vibes
customer_reviews.text: I really like this receiver, even my technophobic wife uses it. I bought it to go with my new samsung un46d6000. They work well together. The remote control is much better then the one I used to have for my Yamaha. The way it auto configs with the supplied mic is great. Oh and the sound quality is great. Have not tried audio return channel but I did try controlling my DVD player through HDMI and thought it was quirky so I turned it off.
customer_reviews.author: sjc

customer_reviews.title: Very Good ! but....
customer_reviews.text: I loved this receiver ! The sound is amazing, a lot of inputs, plays All kinds o digital audio. Plays very well internet radios. Very good for music and video. I Use with Energy RC-Micro with a clear sound. The cons: But the iphone player freeze sometimes, locking the control of the receiver. The OSD is not so intuitive, Onkyo need a new and complete ios app. I recommend this receiver for anyone who need a A/V not so powerful but a very good sound for a small house.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Barci

customer_reviews.title: Onkyo does it again!
customer_reviews.text: I've been a consumer of Onkyo products since 1991 and I have never been disappointed. Onkyo products are innovative and loaded with features; moreover, they are highly reliable compared to similar brands in the same price range. The Onkyo TX-NR609 is the "brain" of my entertainment system with its HDMI management system and RIHD feature. The video enhancement feature really makes a difference as well. I highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Chris DeVaas

customer_reviews.title: Great Reciver
customer_reviews.text: I just love this receiver. I use it for my family room and it gives me great sound. I have used customer service once and they solved the problem right away. The last software patch did fix most of the HDMI auto switching issues. Still a hand up with my DVD player. Internet radio works well. For the price, this receiver is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: G. Barber

customer_reviews.title: sweet technology jump from my old Onkyo
customer_reviews.text: This is a sweet reviver I was looking for balance of POWER and features THX was my main goal I picked this up refurbished and needless to say it is new. after i purchased i contacted onkyo and they explained what work had been done to it and the HDMI problem had been fixed. An that is what i expected when buying this. So I let someone else take the hit. I got it Cheep!
customer_reviews.author: Gonzo1

customer_reviews.title: Love this stereo
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought one of these from a store when they first came out. I loved how it worked and was simple to use so I purchased this one for my parents to replace an old Yamaha that I had given them 16 years ago. The connections allowed me to hook up everything and have it work through one input on the tv. No more late night calls asking what remote controls what.
customer_reviews.author: Archie

customer_reviews.title: I like this!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the features of this product although I have not used the network settings yet. It was a breeze to setup and has more connections than a dealer in Compton. The only complaint I have so far is that when video filtering is on, faint vertical lines appear in the picture. It is bad enough to make me want to turn that feature off. Otherwise, everything works great! It has more than enough power to push my Polk Monitor70s, rm7/rm8 surrounds to the max. Avatar really sounds amazing! (I also turned off edge enhancement in the tv setting and it did not fix the vertical line issue.)
customer_reviews.author: Gtiguy

customer_reviews.title: Best sound ever....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this receiver from Amazon last week with Onkyo SKS HT870 speakers. It took me almost an hour to setup the system, after setup first time connected with my iPhone and wow......what an effect !!......never heard such a great sound........still not connected to TV or watched movie but I am sure it will be out of the world in BD quality..... Had wonderful Friday night slow music party with couple of friends and they were impressed too........... I downloaded some 7.1 THX surround effects from internet and played on it, very much impressed with true cinema surround experience........ Highly recommend this product...........
customer_reviews.author: Rushik Upadhyay

customer_reviews.title: Loved it at first
customer_reviews.text: Loved it at first, very disappointed after 2 yrs.2 moths to the day . Main mother board went out , and had to ship it to a repair center and ended up costing $165.00 + shipping both ways.
customer_reviews.author: phillip snyder

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked great for 6 months, but for the last year on and off the receiver stops sending the video signal thru any HDMI output. The ONLY solution i have found is to completely hard reset the receiver, which of course, you LOSE ALL YOUR SETTINGS. It takes a good 20+ mins to reset it all. Onkyo has said they would repair it, I'm going to send it in but I will NEVER buy another Onkyo product again.
customer_reviews.author: Tonyk518

customer_reviews.title: Looks like the same problem everyone else is having
customer_reviews.text: Unit died after 4 years. Looks like the same problem everyone else is having.
customer_reviews.author: Chris DT

customer_reviews.title: Good luck?
customer_reviews.text: Mine has been awesome is all I can say. Great features. I found it easy to setup and use. Oh yeah, it sounds great through my Klipsch sb-3's too. Not quite as nice as my older HK for music (the HK was buttery smooth and warmer sounding) but considering its mostly for movies and gaming with the odd bit of music blasting I'm really enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: As good as it gets for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Moving to the US, I have been downgrading from a high end TX-9005 (2500$US), to this more recent model.Other than struggling a bit with my European Format Samsung Blue Ray player at times, the sound and image quality coming out of my system is as good as can be. Undoubtedly one of the best picks for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: great little receiver...
customer_reviews.text: It does everything I need (although a 3rd zone would be nice, it doesn't fit in this price range). It has more than enough connectivity/inputs. i use a Logitech harmony, but does Onkyo make a very good remote. The user interface for setup is intuitive, quick, and easy. My only complaint is that the newer onkyo models took away zone 2 balance. Other than that, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Micetic

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, great hook ups, great price! Had a issue with the hdmi board and amazon stepped up and fixed it fast ! A small gripe I have is the usb you'd assume you could plug movies and music to watch with....fail! Must be a service port, but in the front?
customer_reviews.author: Craig H.

customer_reviews.title: Onkyo has done it again!
customer_reviews.text: Onkyo has done it again! This receiver is loaded with features and does it all. This is my 2nd receiver I have purchased from Onkyo. It can handle anything you can throw at it. It can handle 3d! It has plenty of HDMI inputs. It's a great sounding recevier. But my favorite thing is the PRICE! I don't know how Onkyo does it. They pack all the current features in to there receivers yet there still able to keep the price low! That is why I keep coming back to them. Onkyo is the way to go when looking for a A/V receiver! Keep up the good work ONKYO!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: VEry good product, Highly recommend over other receivers
customer_reviews.text: I received the receiver in just 8 days. Installation was very easy, and there it goes with my Bose speakers. Superb cryspy sound. I had brought a new Yamaha from best buy, returned it next day, as it was not user friendly. Dont buy any other receiver, just buy Onkyo!!! Onkyo is way good. My 6 year old can also operate it very easily. Amazon rocks. Onkyo is superb. Highly recomended.
customer_reviews.author: ychare

customer_reviews.title: Great Amp for under $400
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and THX surround sound is seamless... Very transparent with my Martin Logan MLT-2 5.1 plus 2 surround speaker from JBL. Clean but the Video output is not as clear as original source... Video from my PC 1080p to Reciever creates Text that is digitalized... Like the text doesn't appear clear as original source. Did try the internet radio or Onkyo Remote app yet. Looks good so far!
customer_reviews.author: blanka

customer_reviews.title: good home theater
customer_reviews.text: Its an entry-level of Onkyo home but very good equipment for this range price. Technical support even outside of USA is good.
customer_reviews.author: evandro vuono

customer_reviews.title: First unit was DOA. Second took 13 months n
customer_reviews.text: First unit never worked. With second omîAuddessy sound setup quite good. Performance good while it lasted. UI is mediocre and remote is atrocious. None of this matters when mid movie, it goes pop, and dies. Warranty long gone. Customer Service not impressive. W Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Onkyo TX-NR609 Great AV receiver for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this AV receiver to upgrade my audio stack to HDMI. Replaced a Denon, honestly didn't expect the Onkyo to be in the same class. Boy, what time can do for electronics. The Onkyo for $375 seems to be as good as the Denon I paid $1600 for 14 years ago. I doesn't seem to have quite as much power, but it delivers clean sound to more audio level than I can stand. This thing has more features than I can list, most notably the Audyssey program that sets up your surround for you. This is great for non-audiophiles like me who don't take time to learn all we should. I give this unit an A+ for value.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: I just joined the club
customer_reviews.text: 22 months in with quite a few intermittent HDMI "glitches". Now I have zero sound from any HDMI source. Powering off and waiting fixed it for a bit. Then I did a firmware upgrade and it was OK again for a week or so. Now I am back to being dead in the water. Factory resets, power offs, prayers...nothing works. ONKYO sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Rick in the great NW

customer_reviews.title: Great Center Piece for you Home Audio Video Setup.
customer_reviews.text: What a great product. I connected (via HDMI) a LG 3D Plasma, Panasonic 3D BluRay, Panasonic VHS/DVD, Cable Box and XBox. There are a few functions that I'm still trying to out with the remote control but over all, the Onkyo Remote handles all the components seamlessly. I've set up a 5.1 speaker configuration and the surround sound effect is outstanding. Friends constantly look around the room because of realism of the sound in relationship to what is happening on the screen. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Guy H. Kingsley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome receiver Awesome Service
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Receiver. I did encounter the dreaded HDMI failure and Onkyo sent me the box and all the shipping materials need to repair it free of charge 5 years later. Doesn't get better than that.
customer_reviews.author: BOB

customer_reviews.title: Had to send it in for repair after 2-3 years ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to send it in for repair after 2-3 years of use as did most other NR609 owners; Onkyo did the right thing and covered the repair costs even a few months post-warranty.
customer_reviews.author: --jl--

customer_reviews.title: HDMI QUIT and apparently so has Onkyo Customer Service.
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to set up unless you're a true audiophile. Once set up very happy with the sound and performance. ....at least until the HD MI card blew without notice. Have contacted Onkyo via email several times without response. Going to give up and just purchase a new AV receiver......but it won't be an Onkyo!
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Crosby

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality - complex to use and broke in 3 years
customer_reviews.text: The days of these receivers have passed. It extremely complex to setup or use. Secondly it stopped working for no apparent reason after 3 years. We had Bose AV38 in another room, that worked reliably and well for 10 years!!
customer_reviews.author: Sanjay

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and setup. Automatically adjusts 5 channels with its includes sensor placed where you select (likely sitting spot). Updates available from website. Easily switch between inputs devices.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Lawler

customer_reviews.title: Another unit with snapping-popping-crackling noises
customer_reviews.text: Great while it worked (ok, the s/w is pretty klunky). But mine fell victim to the renowned crackling channel problem. I bought this just a couple months before the 2011 recall. Found out about the problem when mine started popping. Wont be buying another product from Onkyo.
customer_reviews.author: BB270

customer_reviews.title: Great for a while, but...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Onkyo receiver in 5 years. A little over a year after purchase, each of them has died, this one included. It will not even turn on. I loved this receiver, great sound, video is great, plenty of inputs and problem free till I came home today and discovered it will not even power on. I love the way Onkyos sound, but they just don't last at all. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: T. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: No sound after 26 months!
customer_reviews.text: The unit is just over the 2 year warranty. It's our central home theater unit and has performed beautifully until now. We loved it. From what I'm reading, it sounds like I'm having the same HDMI card failure many others have had. I'm beginning to work with Onkyo service now. Stay tuned...
customer_reviews.author: Leann P Gage

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like I thought it should ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Onkyo. I've gotten good service out of the first two so why go somewhere else??? It makes surround sound sound like I've always thought it should. The microphone calibration of the speakers give a good starting point and then allows for some tweaking to get the sound the way you want it. Plugged in the Ipod and listen to all of my music. I would and have recommended this receiver to friends and family. The wireless dongle for WiFi was disappointing, I somehow missed that it only worked with audio files. But over all I'm very satisfied with this receiver.
customer_reviews.author: brezz

customer_reviews.title: Love this receiver
customer_reviews.text: Love this receiver. Everything I own is connected to it. Buy the USB wifi adapter to use the internet radio channels. cheaper than buying the 709 model ($20 USB Key by Onkyo)
customer_reviews.author: Riz

customer_reviews.title: After 17 months it just stopped sending video to the TV
customer_reviews.text: I had been very happy with this product since the purchase back in March 2012. Now, 17 months later the unit just stopped sending video to the TV. If I leave it turned off for a day I can get video for about 3-4 hours but then it cuts out again. The unit gets extremely hot and I'm guessing that this has caused some components within the unit to fail. Sad, really, as I liked it. Reading online it appears that this is a common failure of this Onkyo AVR.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Suffers from static problem but serial not covered
customer_reviews.text: This thing stinks. At first I loved it. It fit a price and feature ratio perfectly, but now less than 2 years later I've been dealing with the static issue that some people were able to get covered under a recall. Mine fell out out of the covered serial numbers so no love. The point of a receiver is to give good sound. Instead, this thing provides crisp static over everything you listen to. It's useless.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mcintire

customer_reviews.title: Out of the box to awesome sound in under 30 mins
customer_reviews.text: I honestly just needed something to do HDMI switching. Upgraded from an old Denon system that was 15 years old. This thing sounds great. Works nicely w/ Logitech Harmony. Switches my at&t u-verse DVR, sony BRD, and Apple TV nicely. All good. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: #ATLUTD

customer_reviews.title: The user interface is terrible. The fan is insufficient
customer_reviews.text: The user interface is terrible. The fan is insufficient. I had to send it back to get repaired for a "one time" fix. When it blows again, I will be out of luck. I love some of the options, but the options like bluetooth and wireless control are currently available through most other companies. Once it was setup, it performed well.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Pedersen

customer_reviews.title: No sound just after 2 year mark...
customer_reviews.text: The same issue as many others have been reporting. Worked fine (actually, I tohught it was great) for a little over 2 years. Then, all of a sudden, no sound. The option for firmware update is blocked (both via usb or online) and I am out of ideas. Just ordered a Pinoeer ot replace it - hopefully that will last longer. From what I've read, it doesn't seem worth my while to bother with Onkyo customer service/ repairs... I just won't buy another product from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Brandan C. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: good receiver
customer_reviews.text: This is a good receiver. It works great once you have it set up properly and that is the key, getting it set up properly. The instruction manual need to be written better as it is very difficult to follow if you do not have much knowledge in setting up your home theater system. But once you have it set up you will have some good sounds.
customer_reviews.author: mc

customer_reviews.title: onkyo DOA with one channel DEAD
customer_reviews.text: I bought this receiver and waited two months to hook it up. I know, but things came up. One channel is Kaput. The time passed when I could return the item without penalty and I cannot find ANYWHERE to fix the $&*%ing thing. Not Best Buy or even Onkyo wants to bother to get it "refurbished" AT MY EXPENSE. Buy from somewhere else so you get a longer warranty and perhaps some consideration for your patronage. I am going to send it back and take whatever loss, doesn't anyone fix these things anymore? No more Onkyos for me... Amazon users check your purchases IMMEDIATELY.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: ... receivers I had - worked very well and sounded great for a couple of years
customer_reviews.text: As with the last two Onkyo receivers I had - worked very well and sounded great for a couple of years, then one thing or another fails. This was my last Onkyo purchase.
customer_reviews.author: sixfoot

customer_reviews.title: HDMI cables all go to RCVR with one output to TV
customer_reviews.text: I like the product, great sound easy to set-up,I have a Samsung TV which has it's HDMI going to the RCVR, when I turn the TV on and not the RCVR, to use just the TV's speakers, I get a no signal, cycle TV on/off and then I get a signal, might be something I missed in the set-up, would recomend
customer_reviews.author: buster

customer_reviews.title: Sweet amp
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this amp to power Polk Audio Monitor II series speakers for my home theater system. So far I am very pleased with the product. One thing that wasn't mentioned anywhere but which I have found is that this amplifier allows you to bi-wire the front speakers if you aren't using a 7.1 system. It it powerful enough that I can't turn it all the way up in my apartment for fear of being evicted. The sounds is not as sweet as was that of my old Marantz 2238b but with my new TV that only has optical out for sound I couldn't use it for that purpose anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: I'm living in Australia and bought this online. I have configured this with PolkAudio RTi A7 2x floor standing , CSi A6 Center and DSW PRO 550wi Sub and sounds really amazing. The only concern that I have is, need to increase volume level up to 50-60 to get real sound, may be I have chosen wrong speakers or I have connect them wrong. Other than that all-in-all good amplifier with decent features.
customer_reviews.author: Rasika

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this item it does everything it says it does the sound is like so good I have my wife jumping around when I am watching movies the sounds are so real and seem to be right there next to you. Great device would buy it and recomended without any questions.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo Bustamante

customer_reviews.title: Recalled and fixed for free.  A lot of these stopped working after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Had to send back for recall after 3 years. Onkyo fixed it for free but I had to buy another one until it was fixed.
customer_reviews.author: C5Galaxy

customer_reviews.title: Love the sound, connectivity, ... BUT...
customer_reviews.text: Just after few weeks the all the back HDMI connections both in & out wont work anymore. Had to return for another unit, but just after 4 mos, the HDMI-out of the new unit wont work again! I have to use the optical cable, the component or composite video channels!! Cannot return because its way past the 1 mo return policy!! What happened ONKYO! Check your quality control!!
customer_reviews.author: Chibii

customer_reviews.title: NR609, pass on this one for any price.
customer_reviews.text: 2.5 years, stopped working, no sound (yup, .5 out of warrantee). Unable to update firmware even after reset (via NET or USB, both grayed out). Just dropped it at a Onkyo authorized service center. Based on google searches this is a VERY common occurrence with the NR609. I will update with results after resolved.
customer_reviews.author: D. O'Neil

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until HDMI audio failed
customer_reviews.text: Just a couple of months out of warrantee, no sounds via HDMI. Updating to the latest firmware didn't help, neither did a full reset. A quick search returns numerous issues with HDMI on this receiver. Had my Rotel for a decade without any issues. Hard to believe this model made it out of quality assurance.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Saarela

customer_reviews.title: 3 years with it, still going strong. One ...
customer_reviews.text: 3 years with it, still going strong. One time I had to do a factory reset due to no picture and no sound, but that was the only scary situation I dealt with this receiver. I use the Harman Kardon HKTS-15 5.1 speakers and it's connected to a PS1, PS2, PS3, Wii, WiiU, XBox360, N64 and my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Enderall

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!!
customer_reviews.text: So far no issues! It sounds great and has done everything we need it to! We had an Onkyo receiver before and we liked it and replaced it with a new Onkyo receiver bc we wanted one that would pass through audio and video instead of just video and 3D also.
customer_reviews.author: C. Young

customer_reviews.title: One more failed unit
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, one for an uncle of mine, and one for myself. My uncle used his unit daily and it stopped sending out sound a out 18 months later. My use is more infrequent and the sound died on mine at the 24 month mark.
customer_reviews.author: Wesam Abdallah

customer_reviews.title: Bad investment
customer_reviews.text: It failed just outside the 2-year warranty. The HDMI board failed and Onkyo wants $450 to repair. I will never purchase another of these dogs at any price.
customer_reviews.author: JPT

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver
customer_reviews.text: I mainly use this receiver for watching movies however listent to music with it is amazing also. Numerous feature. Great music apps also. I would recommend Onkyo to all of my friend. Great price and amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece - horrible service
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in January 2012 and enjoyed the nice, rich, clear sound. Until August when it lost the ability to transmit video. Covered under warranty (I'm assuming - don't have the unit back yet). Very difficult to find a service center. They had to order parts from Onkyo in the USA. USA is out of part and it goes on and on. Bottom line is that for some fairly basic electronic parts, they delivered poorly and have kept my system from me for over 7 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: C. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Onkyo TX - NR609
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a relative and so far this has been an excellent receiver. It has great bang for your buck... Lots of features packed in to this unit. This unit is especially attractive for it's internet radio and DLNA ability. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: JLob

customer_reviews.title: onkyo receiver
customer_reviews.text: the quality of the product is unmatched,as is the value and pricing.the ease of operation and setup is super easy.It has plenty of hdmi hook ups which today you need. It has plenty of power and makes watching tv and movies just totally awsom...
customer_reviews.author: chuckster

product_meta.title: Onkyo TX - NR609 7.2 Channel Network THX Certified A/V Receiver (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Targeting the sweet spot where affordability meets superb functionality, the TX-NR609 looks set to be another Onkyo classic. This THX Select2 Plus Certified A/V receiver handles content from all your favorite disc-based media, as well as networked and wireless audio content from the internet, iPod/iPhone, and PC. Six HDMI inputs—including one on the front panel—provide support for 3D video and ultra-high resolution 4K video upscaling via Marvell Qdeo. HDMI also carries master-quality audio formats from Dolby and DTS, as well as the expanded surround sound of Audyssey DSX and Dolby Pro Logic IIz. Three-stage inverted Darlington circuitry and Onkyo’s proprietary WRAT ensure a clean and compelling amplifier performance. And when audio signals are output, the 7.2-channel configuration includes twin subwoofer pre-outs for added bass impact. Meanwhile, a user-friendly on-screen display and GUI make it easy to adjust settings and navigate your content. All this and more makes the TX-NR609 an irresistible choice for the value-seeking home theater fan.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


LET THE SHOW BEGIN!
The TX-NR609 is an immediate Onkyo classic, showcasing all the latest in matchless technology. This THX® Select2 Plus™ Certified network A/V receiver handles so much content- from disc-based media, to internet radio, iPod®/iPhone®, and PC and Android devices. Six HDMI® inputs- including one on the front panel- provide support for 3D video and ultra-high resolution display technology. HDMI also carries master-quality audio formats from Dolby and DTS, as well as the expanded surround sound of Audyssey DSX™ and Dolby® Pro Logic® IIz. Three-stage inverted Darlington circuitry and Onkyo's proprietary WRAT ensure a clean and compelling amplifier performance. And when audio signals are output, the 7.2-channel configuration includes twin subwoofer pre-outs for added bass impact. All this and more makes the TX-NR609 an irresistible choice: it's the best bang for your buck. Let the show begin! ONKYO HAS MORE THX-CERTIFIED A/V RECEIVERS THAN ANY OTHER MANUFACTURER.
With a THX-certified Onkyo A/V receiver, you know you're experiencing movie soundtracks the way they were recorded and produced to be heard. You're getting the power and nuance the director made for the cinema, the very best sound quality available, in your own home. This THX Select2 Plus certification is specified for rooms where the screen to-seat-viewing distance is 10 to 12 feet and the room volume is around 2000 cubic feet. THX Loudness Plus is included in the specification.

ONKYO NETWORK A/V RECEIVERS GIVE YOU ACCESS TO MORE INTERNET RADIO STATIONS THAN ANY OTHER BRAND...PERIOD. 


Streaming your choice of internet radio through your Onkyo A/V receiver gives you unsurpassed sound quality and access to a virtually infinite selection of world class music. Enjoy your own personal concert from anywhere in the world... right in your own living room. 

All Onkyo network receivers are also compatible with Microsoft’s Windows® 7 platform, which includes the DLNA 1.5-specified “Play To” media-streaming feature so you can easily stream music store on PCs connected to your home network. This internet connectivity has the added benefit of making firmware updates simpler than ever.

UWF-1 WIRELESS LAN ADAPTOR
Onkyo's UWF-1 Wireless LAN adaptor removes unwanted cables. This small, optional unit is worth way more than its tiny price. Connect the UWF-1 to the USB port on any compatible 2011 Onkyo network receiver, and bring your music through your wireless router into your Onkyo system. Now internet radio and audio files stored on your PC can be played back with the superior fidelity of your main Onkyo system — with no cable clutter. A sensible and inexpensive solution.

ONKYO'S REMOTE APPS
Onkyo's Remote Apps for Android and iPod/iPhone turn your cell phone into a remote control. The Android app lets you Stream audio files from your Android to your Onkyo home network receiver. Set tone, volume levels and control input selection, as well as a number of other key features like controlling internet radio stations…

The Onkyo app for iPhone/iPod will allow you to set tone, volume levels and control input selection. 



MADE FOR IPOD®/IPHONE®
Onkyo receivers allow you to and play audio files stored on your iPod/iPhone or even a USB flash drive. The on screen display lets you see exactly what is playing. As the audio signals are played back in digital form, rather than analog, there is much less chance for signal degradation. Onkyo's exclusiveAdvanced Music Optimizer also compensates for lost bit information and improves the quality of compressed audio signals.

End result: Your music sounds cleaner and more faithful to the original.

CRISP AND CLEAN 1080P UPSCALING... AND READY FOR NEXT GENERATION DISPLAYS, NOW! 
Onkyo's A/V receiver provides the finest, most beautiful and pristine 1080p upscaling you can find, thanks to the Marvell Qdeo™ video-processing chip that erases video noise and artifacts such as jaggies and feathering. The result: astoundingly crisp video. Played back on a compatible widescreen display, your Blu-ray Discs and standard DVDs will look AMAZING: more detailed and cinematic than ever. While deftly handling the most current high-def display formats, Onkyo's also the first in the world to support the coming full 4K upscaling (3840 x 2160) of standard video sources such as 480i/p, 720p, and 1080i/p. Interlaced-to-progressive conversion and scaling are performed by a high-quality Marvell Qdeo video-processing chip.

3D AND ARC
All Onkyo A/V receivers support the latest in 3D technology. Play 3D movies, games, and broadcast content in cinematic quality in your own home and be amazed by the realistic quality. The HDMI®inputs let you connect multiple high-def sources, such as a Blu-ray player, a gaming console, and a cable/satellite tuner. The HDMI output, on the other hand, lets you send a pristine signal to a compatible high-resolution display. Audio Return Channel allows audio content received directly by your HDTV’s tuner to be sent “upstream” via HDMI to your A/V receiver, without the need for a separate S/PDIF audio cable. 

A SUITE OF AUDYSSEY TECHNOLOGIES
Audyssey 2EQ tailors multi-channel audio for your home theater speaker set-up by measuring three room positions and applying a resolution filter to the satellite speakers to correct for room acoustics.

Audyssey Dynamic EQ maintains a consistent bass response, tonal balance, and surround-sound effect at different volume levels, so you can enjoy the natural dynamics of your content regardless of the volume.

Audyssey Dynamic Volume automatically compensates for volume fluctuations in different audio content (for example, during commercial breaks) while optimizing the dynamic range. 
DOLBY® PRO LOGIC® IIZ
Allows reconfiguration of the surround back channels to deliver “front height” channels. These channels carry ambient, non-directional audio that adds a new vertical dimension to your movies and games. Audyssey DSX provides a similar front-height speaker option that likewise works to create a more enveloping home theater experience.

CHANGE YOUR RECEIVER'S SETTINGS SEAMLESSLY
Thanks to Onkyo's overlaid graphical on-screen display (OSD), set-up menus appear on top of the video image you're watching, so you don't have to switch to a blank screen background. Easily navigate intuitive menus to maximize all of the features and benefits of your Onkyo A/V receiver. The OSD and Graphical User Interface (GUI) both operate over HDMI, making excellent use of that versatile interface. EXTRA CONNECTIVITY OPTIONS
UsePC-INto easily connect your notebook or mediacenter PC to your Onkyo AV receiver, and watch your movie files on your flatscreen TV. You can now easily watch internet videos, PC-stored movies and pictures on your TV. (Audio connectivity may vary depending on your computer hardware, but Onkyo A/V receivers support a wide range of different interfaces.) COMPARISON CHART
